questions.text: In chemical bonding, electrons in these bonds are attached to the nuclei of both atoms holding them together as a molecule with overlapping shells.
They form when bonded atoms have a lower energy and only between non-metallic elements.
Name these types of chemical bonding when electrons have a strong short-ranged attraction due to sharing of electrons.
This is a fundamental law of chemistry that explains why we need to balance chemical equations.
This law requires that all atoms before the reaction must appear in some form after the reaction in the same numbers.
What law suggests that matter can neither be created nor destroyed?
This phylum contains the tunicates and lancelets.
Animals in this phylum possess a flexible notochord at some point in their lives and this phylum contains all the vertebrates.
To what phylum do mammals, birds, and fishes belong?
This rock is found in high amounts on the moon and it is the most common igneous rock on Earth.
This igneous rock is high in iron and magnesium but low in silica and forms when lava rapidly cools.
Name this dark igneous rock that is the primary component of the ocean crust.
This major sedimentary rock has a hardness on Mohs scale between three and four making it easily carved, so it was used by ancients to make buildings like the pyramids of Giza.
Acid precipitation can weather and erode this rock and release carbon dioxide.
What is this sedimentary rock of calcium and carbonate that formed in warm, shallow seas from the shells of ancient creatures?
This scientist's work titled On The Revolutions of the Heavenly Spheres was published the year of his death.
This astronomer cited evidence that at times the outer planets could be seen moving backwards in the sky in retrograde motion and he refuted the geocentric theory for the solar system.
Who was this Polish astronomer who first proposed the heliocentric solar system?
Without this type of radiant energy, most of life would not be able to survive.
This radiation type of energy is emitted by a hot body through waves in the electromagnetic spectrum of which we only see on the visible spectrum.
What is this type of energy that is propagated by waves that we receive mostly from the Sun?
When these fungal structures have dividing walls they are said to be septate.
These structures are well adapted to absorb nutrients and they make form dense networks called a mycelium.
Name these long fungal filaments that make up a fungal body.
This plant behavior is regulated by phytochromes that respond to red and far-red light.
It's not phototropism, but this behavior may lead to a growth response to light or darkness.
What is this response by flowering plants to the number of hours of daylight and darkness?
This organic compound class is the most abundant among the major biomolecules and appears to be more ample in plants rather than animals.
Most of these compounds provide 4 calories of energy per gram when consumed, although cellulose cannot be digested for energy by humans.
What is this main group of compounds made of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen that provides energy for cells, examples of which are sugars and starches?
The bumblebee variety of these animals is the world's smallest mammal by length at just 33 millimeters.
These mammals are in order Chiroptera and they have a thin membrane of skin between the digits of their forelimbs.
What is this only flying mammal?
This eukaryotic organelle is a series of folded sacs that produce secretory vesicles.
This organelle often receives proteins from the endoplasmic reticulum.
What organelles modify, package, and secrete cellular products?
These celestial objects were named for the Greek word for wanderer and are classified by their composition and size.
To be classified as such, these objects must be massive enough to be spherical in shape and they must clear their orbital neighborhood of other objects.
What are these large spherical bodies in space that orbits a star such as the Sun?
Persons with this condition may have a partial immunity to the parasitic disease malaria.
This condition is caused by a mutation in the beta-goblin gene, which may lead to red blood cells becoming stuck in small vessels, causing pain.
What is this type of anemia that causes the red blood cells to be shaped like a crescent moon?
These cells are considered to be haploid, in that they have only a single copy of each chromosome.
These cells are typically produced four at a time during meiosis.
What are these cells that fuse to create a zygote?
The straight arrows in this diagram represent the direction of energy flow from prey predator.
This diagram shows energy across the trophic levels and it ends in an apex predator.
What are these simple, linear models of energy flow in an ecosystem that are not as complex as a web?
These tiny organs are located inside small bumps called papillae in our mouths that can alert our brains if something is safe to consume.
These organs have five senses of flavor from sweet and salty to bitter and sour.
What are these sensory organs that mainly around on our tongues that help us enjoy our food.
There are different rules in chemistry for writing these molecular representations depending on the type of bond portrayed.
Chemical symbols are used with the corresponding capital and lowercase letters with the right amount of numbers and numerical subscripts which must be balanced in a chemical equation.
What do we call these expressions in chemistry that show the elements in a compound and their proportional amounts?
Not all compounds that contain hydrogen are these but these substances are created by the donation of hydrogen ions, its protons, or acceptance of electron pairs.
Its name comes from the Latin for sour which is how it tastes, though strong ones of these substances can burn the skin.
What is this substance that turns litmus paper red, has a pH less than 7, and reacts with bases?
These organs in aquatic insects may be found along the abdomen.
In fish, these organs are covered by a hard plate called the operculum and long strands of tissue making up these organs are called filaments.
What are these organs that fish and other aquatic animals use to extract oxygen from water?
In an ecosystem, this factor includes heterotrophs, autotrophs, detritivores, predation, and symbiosis.
One way to classify this factor is by how they obtain their nutritional needs such as producers or consumers and these factors do not include nonliving entities.
What do we call any living factor within an environment?
This form of lava moves the fastest but it is the most viscous.
This lava rock cools quickly and it is made of sharp particles called clinkers.
Name this rough, jagged lava that is more viscous than pahoehoe.
This scientist, though his work with cell theory, realized that fermentation is caused by microorganisms and disproved spontaneous generation.
Through this research, he developed vaccines for rabies and anthrax, but he is most noted for his food preparation process that killed microbes.
Who was this French scientist that through his research on microorganisms developed a process to remove bacteria from raw milk.
A version of this law of motion is the rocket equation which explains how the thrust of a rocket changes as the mass of the rocket fuel decreases.
Numerically, this law follows the Law of Inertia.
Which law of motion defines force as the product of mass and acceleration?
This is the part of the fungus that does most of the decomposing in their environment.
This makes up the majority of a fungus and it consists of a network of underground hyphae.
What is the vegetative part of a fungus?
This plant hormone was first noted by Charles Darwin when he noticed the phototropism of a grass plant.
This hormone will congregate on the dark side of a plant's stem and leaves, elongate, and the plant then grows toward the light.
Name this plant hormone that causes an increase in plant growth.
This geographic theme helps explain why Louisville has a community called Germantown, and why Georgetown, Kentucky, has a Toyota plant.
It also helps explain the popularity of holidays such as St. Patrick's Day and Cinco de Mayo in the U.S.
Which geographic theme explains how people, goods, and ideas get from one place to another?
This quantity, often symbolized with "Q", depends on the thermal conductivity of a material.
This quantity is not internal thermal energy because it is transferred between two systems due to a temperature difference.
What is this flow of energy from a hotter object to a colder one?
This classification of organic compounds are synthesized by the smooth endoplasmic reticulum, and when combined with proteins, are the essential constituents of a cell's membranes.
As a nonpolar molecule, they are not soluble in polar molecules such as water, and are obtained usually through the consumption of other animals.
Name this group of compounds that are composed of fats and oils which are used to store energy.
The amount a person needs of these daily depends in sex, age, and levels of activity, and some people count how many they intake daily.
We get them from the foods we eat and if you have a higher level of activity, you need more than a person that is more sedentary.
What are these units of energy that we get from our food that if we intake too much will lead to being overwieght?
The name of this animal can translate literally from the Greek as "a 'fish' with a womb."
These animals have flippers, a dorsal fin, and, like whales, a small blowhole.
Give the name of these aquatic mammals that include Amazon River, orcas, and bottlenose.
These round membrane-bound organelles are found only in animal cells and contain hydrolytic enzymes that are created in the Golgi apparatus.
Their function is to find unwanted components within a cell, use their acidic environment, and dispose of it.
Name this type of vesicle that is responsible for the digestion and dissolving of unwanted parts or wastes of a cell.
We often think of these changes as detrimental, but they can also be positive and enhance an individual's adaptive ability.
These alterations to genetic material are only passed on to offspring if they occur in the production of gametes.
What is any change in the genetic code of an organism occurring naturally or through environmental factors like radiation?

hints: accept any form of the word

questions.text: This body structure can become abnormally dilated in individuals with Marfan Syndrome.
This structure begins at the left ventricular semilunar valve and begins branching almost immediately into smaller arteries.
Name this largest artery of the body.
This type of chemical bond will occur when two nonmetals share a pair of electrons and molecules are symmetrical.
These types of bonds are not positive or negative because their shape causes the particles to cancel and are neutral.
What is this type of covalent bond where electrons are shared equally like in carbon dioxide or methane?
Large quantities of these subatomic particles are released during nuclear fusion and fission and are located in an atom's nucleus.
These particles consist of one up quark and two down quarks and are responsible for an atom's isotopes.
What are these subatomic particles that are located in the nucleus of atoms and have no charge?
Like birds and reptiles, these animals possess a cloaca which is a single opening for waste, urine, and gametes to be expelled.
These mammals produce milk but have no nipples and examples include only the echidnas and platypus.
What are these mammals that lay eggs?
It's not a desert, bout this biome receives very little annual precipitation, usually less than 10 inches.
This biome is treeless and it is characterized permafrost in the soil.
Which cold biome is primarily found in the Arctic?
This specific location was reached in 2012 by filmmaker James Cameron in a vessel specially built to withstand crushing pressures.
This location, first visited by Walsh and Piccard, was named for a British survey ship and it is found in the Mariana Trench.
What is this deepest known point of Earth's oceans?
This kingdom of organisms can be classified on their form of locomotion, such as with pseudopodia, cilia, flagella, or non-motile forms.
This kingdom is highly diverse with both photosynthetic and heterotrophic organisms and its member are eukaryotic and primarily unicellular.
Name this kingdom of organisms that contains the protozoa and algae.
This law of motion can be seen when escaping air from a balloon results in the balloon traveling in the other direction.
This law explains how chairs hold our weight when we sit on them.
What is this law of motion that suggests for each and every action there will be an equal and opposite reaction?
This specialize structure in birds consists of a stretchy, muscular pouch that some use to produce milk for their young like pigeons.
In insects such as cockroaches, it is an enlarged part of the esophagus that will discharge into the gut for later digestion.
What is this specialized structure where ingested food is stored for later digestion and is sometimes called a craw?
The rotation of these celestial objects provided Vera Rubin with evidence for dark matter in the Universe.
Most of these objects have a supermassive black hole at their centers and these may be classified as elliptical or spiral types.
What are these large groupings of stars and solar systems like the Milky Way?
The two primary varieties of this geologic feature are coastal and interior.
These features cover more than one-third of the Earth's surface.
Identify the large areas of the Earth's surface that are relatively flat to gently sloping, such as the great ones that extend northward from Texas to Canada.
The SI unit for this quantity was named for the inventor of the modern electric battery.
This quantity is the product of electrical current and resistance and it causes electrons to flow in a circuit.
What is the difference in electrical potential between two points in an electrical circuit, named for an Italian physicist?
This plant group has a dominant phase called the gametophyte stage.
This plant group lacks xylem and phloem and it includes the hornworts, liverworts, and mosses.
Name these nonvascular plants.
This category of biomolecules are important for molecular transport and structural support that consist of macromolecules of polypeptides.
These biomolecules make up enzymes and most tissues, and they are assembled by the cell's ribosomes.
What are these groups of organic compounds that help build and repair cells through chains of amino acids?
An incident involving one of these in 1883 destroyed the island of Krakatoa and created the loudest sound in human history.
Olympus Mons is the largest one of these in the Solar System and types of them include composite, cinder cone, and shield.
What are these openings or vents in Earth’s crust that spew rocks, gases, and lava onto Earth’s surface?
This American scientist and prolific inventor is also known for his work as a diplomat during the early years of our country.
Some of his inventions were a rocking chair that moved an overhead palmetto leaf for air circulation, a stove, and bifocal glasses.
Who was this American scientist and founding father known for his experiments in electricity?
This type of transportation of substances into and out of a cell’s membrane is based on the concentration gradient and can only flow one way.
Substances always move down their concentration gradient in this type of transport with examples of osmosis and diffusion.
What is this type of transport through a cell’s membrane that does not require using the cell’s energy?
In somatic cells, this stage of mitosis occurs immediately after the Gap 2 stage.
The spindle apparatus forms during this stage which occurs before metaphase.
In which phase of mitosis do chromosomes tightly coil, the first stage of mitosis?
Macrophages [MACK-rho-fahjz-ez] are cells within this system that are nonspecific and the white pulp of the spleen houses many of this system's cells.
Lymphatic vessels improve the efficiency of this system and the skin is considered the first line of defense for this system that features white blood cells.
What is this body system that defends against foreign and disease-causing substances?
